intro: Patania scabra, commonly known as the rough patania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Patania scabra is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
